intro: Rhynchospora locuples, commonly known as the common spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and dense clusters of small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as bogs, fens, and along the edges of ponds. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. Rhynchospora locuples plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
